ygData.subject: Re: Warriors vs Wizards
ygData.msgSnippet: You ignore the main difference between the two, one can only strike agfainst a single opponent, while the other works against groups of opponents.  Oh, and
ygData.messageBody:
You ignore the main difference between the two, one can only strike agfainst
a single opponent, while the other works against groups of opponents. Oh,
and yes, I have a very good clue about game balance. Right now, it is out
of balance, otherwise we would have warriors being able to solo just as
easily as Mages, Necros, Rangers and the like.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Wayne Sheppard [mailto:mrwayne@...]
> Sent: Friday, June 11, 1999 7:26 AM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: [warriors_eq] Warriors vs Wizards
>
>
> From: "Wayne Sheppard" <mrwayne@...>
>
> Many of the Warriors here have complained that they cannot do
> damage as fast
> as a Wizard.
>
> THEY ARE NOT SUPPOSED TO.
>
> Now all of you real life ninjas and steel sword swinging
> fools just calm
> down. Read carefully.
>
>
> Warriors get to wear platemail and have many more hps than a Wizard.
> Warriors also have a higher Offense, Defense, and Weapon
> skills. This all
> means that a Warrior can stand toe to toe against an NPC.
>
> Now lets make a Warrior have the same ability to deal damage
> as a Wizard.
> Now we would have a class that has the best armor, the highest combat
> skills, the most hp's AND the ability to deal the most damage.
>
> Why would anyone want to play a Wizard if a Warrior could do
> as much damage
> AND be able to take blows in melee?
>
>
> Wayne
> PS - When someone says that a Warrior should be able to deal
> as much damage
> as fast as a Wizard I immediately realize this person doesn't
> have a clue
> about game balance.
>
>
